augment.chat.userGuidelines:
General Principles
Don't comment obvious code; keep it self-explanatory
Adding comments will only increase maintenance cost over time
Omit using comments in the code if it's obvious or self-explanatory
Never create duplicate files—search the repo first
Always follow existing code style and structure
Prefer modifying existing functions over creating new ones
Don't maintain backward compatibility unless required
Always import packages at the top—no in-line imports
TypeScript Best Practices
Never use 'any' type under any circumstances - always find type-safe alternatives
Use union types with type guards instead of type assertions for property checking
Prefer optional chaining (func?.()) over conditional checks (if (func) { func() })
Use proper return type annotations like Record<string, unknown> instead of any
Create type guards (item is SpecificType) for safe type checking
Use descriptive union types instead of casting to any
Provide clear documentation for edge cases (like when parameters might be undefined)
React/Web Guidelines (web-next)
Avoid useMemo invalidations
Use lodash for debounce and utility needs
Use camelCaseObjectKeys for server data
Prefer optional chaining for cleaner conditional calls
API Guidelines (consumer-client-api-gateway)
Target only what's needed—no wide changes
Use dvsClient.getBoolean() (not runtimeDynamicValues())
Import experiments from ExperimentNames
Use specific typed interfaces with descriptive names
Pass minimal, focused parameter objects
Keep variants consistent in behavior and signatures
Add clear, purpose-driven comments where needed
Use feature flags for opt-in changes; fallback gracefully
Code Quality Standards
Use stable identifiers for tracking instead of random strings
Document when function parameters can be undefined and why
Prefer deterministic fallback logic over random generation
Use type-safe property access with proper type guards
Avoid
Broad-scoped updates
Passing large context objects
Deprecated APIs
Generic types like any (use proper types instead)
Type assertions (as any, as unknown as) - use type guards instead
Exporting locally used types
Unary ops (++, --)
Violating .eslintrc or code style rules
Random string generation for stable identifiers
Conditional checks when optional chaining is cleaner
